definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: But she had come this far, she wasn't going to back out now.
sentences.chinese: 不过既然大老远跑来，绝不会此刻罢手。

sentences.english: Take airplane and greatly and from afar bring to China to this niggard.
sentences.chinese: 坐着飞机大老远的把这个吝啬鬼送到中国。

sentences.english: You dragged me all the way out here to watch a war movie?
sentences.chinese: 你大老远拖我到这里来看战争片？

sentences.english: I dont know why anyone would want to use their money visiting a zoo so far away.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道为什么会有人会花钱跑大老远参观动物园。

sentences.english: Thanks for coming all the way over here.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你大老远的来到这儿。

sentences.english: They came all the way from Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 他们大老远的从巴西来。

sentences.english: I knew I was on the right move to come so far away from China.
sentences.chinese: 我知道大老远从中国跑到这里来，算是来对了。

sentences.english: I came all this way here to get stuck on the wrong and of this rock pile?
sentences.chinese: 我跑了这么大老远，就这样被困在石头堆里？

sentences.english: "What made you decide to move here all the way from the North-East?" I asked.
sentences.chinese: “怎么想到要大老远地从东北搬到这里来？”我问。

sentences.english: You came all the way from to give me a lecture?
sentences.chinese: 你大老远从伦敦来到这里就为了教训我？

sentences.english: Thank you for coming to my home away from home.
sentences.chinese: 感谢你大老远地到我这来做客。

definition: (adverbial phrase used with verbs such as 歸|归[gui1] or 赴[fu4] etc) traveling a great distance
by the way/while out doing sth else/conveniently
to go on an errand for nothing/to go on a wild-goose chase
to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
worthwhile (often in rhetorical questions, implying not worthwhile)/also written 犯得上
